title: Experienced Medical Biller Full time US PST Hours
job_overview:
Job Description:
We are a growing healthcare organization looking for an experienced Medical Biller to support our billing operations and financial reporting processes.

Key Responsibilities:
Prepare and submit medical claims accurately to Medicare, Medicaid, and commercial insurance payers
Review Explanation of Benefits (EOBs) and manage claim denials, rejections, and appeals
Reconcile payments received with billing records to ensure revenue accuracy
Generate and analyze Accounts Receivable (AR) aging reports and follow up on outstanding claims
Maintain detailed and compliant documentation in line with HIPAA regulations
Assist with monthly financial close and ensure revenue recognition complies with GAAP
Collaborate with the accounting team to integrate billing data into financial reports
Identify discrepancies in billing and recommend process improvements
Provide regular reports on key billing metrics, such as collection rates, denial rates, and days in AR

Requirements:
Experience & Skills:
3-5 years of medical billing experience in a hospital or physician practice setting
Strong knowledge of CPT, ICD-10, and HCPCS coding
Deep understanding of insurance claims processes and payer guidelines
Proficiency in medical billing software (e.g., eClinicalWorks, Office Ally, Epic, etc.)
Hands-on experience reconciling revenue and ensuring compliance with GAAP principles
Familiarity with healthcare revenue cycle management and financial reporting
Advanced Excel skills for financial analysis and reporting
Exceptional attention to detail and ability to work independently
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with both fee-for-service and value-based payment models
Previous experience in multi-specialty medical practices
Knowledge of CMS regulations and compliance standards

Schedule:
Full-time availability required: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM PST, Monday to Friday (40 hours per week)
No conflicts with other engagements during working hours
Opportunity for long-term engagement based on performance
Performance incentives and PTO available under specific terms and conditions

Work From Home Requirements:
Dedicated laptop or desktop computer
Reliable workspace with power and internet backup
Strict adherence to patient confidentiality and HIPAA compliance

How to Apply:
Please include the following in your application:
Link to your resume
Link to a short video introduction
